meanings.definition: A list or catalog of items, especially in alphabetical or numerical order.
meanings.sent1: The library uses indexes to help people find books easily.
meanings.sent2: She referred to the indexes at the back of the book to locate the information.
meanings.sent3: The indexes in the recipe book made it look like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: His messy desk was like a jungle of indexes waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The indexes in the map were color-coded for easy navigation.

meanings.sent1: The arrow on the signpost indexes the direction to the beach.
meanings.sent2: The indexes on the dashboard showed the fuel level and speed.
meanings.sent3: The indexes on the weather vane spun wildly in the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an index of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The indexes on the compass pointed north with precision.

meanings.definition: A statistical measure of changes in a representative group of individual data points.
meanings.sent1: The stock market index tracks the performance of various companies.
meanings.sent2: Economists use indexes to analyze trends in the economy.
meanings.sent3: The index of student grades showed a surprising improvement.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an index of her joyous mood.
meanings.sent5: The index of inflation indicated a rise in prices.
